rdf:Description.dc:title: Buffalo Bill in the Limelight
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Remington, Frederic, 1861-1909
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Native Americans
Profile
Arenas
rdf:Description.dc:description: Frederic Remington had a long association with his friend, William F. Cody. He visited Cody's Wild West exhibitions on a number of occasions, using the visits to sketch western subjects. Remington produced this painting along with several other illustrations for the biography of Cody, Last of the Great Scouts, written by his sister Helen Cody Wetmore in 1899.
rdf:Description.dc:source: Buffalo Bill Center of the West, Cody, Wyoming; Gift of The Coe Foundation, H.P. Skoglund, Ernest Goppert, Sr. and John S. Bugas, 23.71
